segment.source: When you set up Microsoft Passport, the PIN or biometric (Windows Hello) gesture that you use is specific to that device.
segment.target: When you set up Microsoft Passport, the PIN or biometric (Windows Hello) gesture that you use is specific to that device.

segment.source: You can set up Passport for the same account on multiple devices.
segment.target: You can set up Passport for the same account on multiple devices.

segment.source: If the PIN or biometric is configured as part of a Microsoft Passport for Work, changing the account password will not impact sign-in or unlock with these gestures since it uses a key or certificate.
segment.target: If the PIN or biometric is configured as part of a Microsoft Passport for Work, changing the account password will not impact sign-in or unlock with these gestures since it uses a key or certificate.

segment.source: However, if Microsoft Passport for Work is not deployed and the password for that account changes, you must provide the new password on each device to continue to use Passport.
segment.target: However, if Microsoft Passport for Work is not deployed and the password for that account changes, you must provide the new password on each device to continue to use Passport.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Let's suppose that you have set up a PIN for your Microsoft account on Device A. You use your PIN to sign in on Device A and then change the password for your Microsoft account.
segment.target: Let's suppose that you have set up a PIN for your Microsoft account on Device A. You use your PIN to sign in on Device A and then change the password for your Microsoft account.

segment.source: Because you were using Device A when you changed your password, the PIN on Device A will continue to work with no other action on your part.
segment.target: Because you were using Device A when you changed your password, the PIN on Device A will continue to work with no other action on your part.

segment.source: Suppose instead that you sign in on Device B and change your password for your Microsoft account.
segment.target: Suppose instead that you sign in on Device B and change your password for your Microsoft account.

segment.source: The next time that you try to sign in on Device A using your PIN, sign-in will fail because the account credentials that Passport on Device A knows will be outdated.
segment.target: The next time that you try to sign in on Device A using your PIN, sign-in will fail because the account credentials that Passport on Device A knows will be outdated.

segment.source: Note: This example also applies to an Active Directory account when Passport for Work is not implemented.
segment.target: Note: This example also applies to an Active Directory account when Passport for Work is not implemented.

segment.source: How to update Passport after you change your password on another device
segment.target: How to update Passport after you change your password on another device

segment.source: When you try to sign in using your PIN or biometric, you will see the following message: Your password was changed on a different device. You must sign in to this device once with your new password, and then you can sign in with your PIN.
segment.target: When you try to sign in using your PIN or biometric, you will see the following message: Your password was changed on a different device. You must sign in to this device once with your new password, and then you can sign in with your PIN.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Click Sign-in options.
segment.target: Click Sign-in options.

segment.source: Click the Password button.
segment.target: Click the Password button.

segment.source: Sign in with new password.
segment.target: Sign in with new password.

segment.source: The next time that you sign in, you can select Sign-in options and then select PIN to resume using your PIN.
segment.target: The next time that you sign in, you can select Sign-in options and then select PIN to resume using your PIN.
